intro: Orchis maculata var. ochrantha, commonly known as the spotted orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features tall, erect stems with lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers with a distinctive yellow-green marking on the lower lip, which is a key identifying feature. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Orchis maculata var. ochrantha is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance.
